IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE FOUNDATION'S PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO RECEIVE, INVEST, ACCOUNT FOR, AND ALLOCATE PRIVATE GIFTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS IN SUPPORT OF THE COLLEGE IN THE AREAS OF SCHOLARSHIP, FACULTY EXCELLENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND DEVELOPMENT OF CAMPUS FACILITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS TO SERVE AS AN ADVOCATE FOR GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE, A UNIT OF THE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM OF GEORGIA. THE FOUNDATION'S PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO RECEIVE, INVEST, ACCOUNT FOR, AND ALLOCATE PRIVATE GIFTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS IN SUPPORT OF THE COLLEGE IN THE AREAS OF SCHOLARSHIP, FACULTY EXCELLENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND DEVELOPMENT OF CAMPUS FACILITIES.
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION'S EXEMPT SERVICES ARE TWOFOLD, (I) TO HOLD CAMPUS BUILDINGS UNDER LEASES WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF GEORGIA BOARD OF REGENTS FOR USE BY FACULTY AND STUDENTS OF GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE AND TO DEVELOP ADDITIONAL CAMPUS FACILITIES AS NEEDED; AND (II) TO GENERATE AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL FUNDS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE STUDENTS, PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OF GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE, SPECIFICALLY FOR THE COLLEGE'S CORE NEEDS INCLUDING GRANTS FOR STUDENT AND FACULTY SUPPORT, RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, AND SCHOLARSHIPS, IN ORDER TO HELP THE COLLEGE ACHIEVE ITS STATED GOALS AND OBJECTIVES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GAAP PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR HOW UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS SHOULD BE RECOGNIZED, MEASURED, PRESENTED, AND DISCLOSED IN THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE IMPLICATIONS OF THESE STANDARDS AND HAS NOT IDENTIFIED ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS FOR THE FOUNDATION; THEREFORE, NO TAX EXPENSE OR ACCRUALS ARE INCLUDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE D, PART XI, LINE 2D & PART XII, LINE 2A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INCLUDED IN DONATED SERVICES: GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE FOUNDATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY EMPLOYEES. THERE ARE EMPLOYEES OF GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE, AN UNRELATED ORGANIZATION, WHOSE SERVICES WERE DONATED TO THE FOUNDATION. ALL WERE INVOLVED PRIMARILY IN MANAGEMENT AND DONOR DEVELOPMENT FOR THE FOUNDATION. ALL COMPENSATION DECISIONS ARE HANDLED BY GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE UNDER THE COLLEGE'S COMPENSATION POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. THE FOUNDATION INCLUDES A CONTRIBUTION FROM THE COLLEGE OF "DONATED SERVICES" ON SCHEDULE D AND A CORRESPONDING EXPENSE RELATED TO THESE "DONATED SERVICES" ALSO ON SCHEDULE D.

RecipientTable.NonCashAssistanceDesc: VARIOUS SUPPLIES AND GOODS FOR USE BY THE COLLEGE
RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: GENERAL ACADEMIC, CLASSROOM AND/OR OPERATIONS SUPPLIES IN SUPPORT OF THE COLLEGE
NEED & MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE & FUNDED BY THE FOUNDATION
NEED & MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE & FUNDED BY THE FOUNDATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE LOCATED IN GWINNETT COUNTY, GEORGIA. GRANTS FOR EVENTS, OPERATIONS, AND CLASSROOM AND GENERAL MATERIAL NEEDS ARE IDENTIFIED BY THE COLLEGE, AND A REQUEST IS MADE OF THE FOUNDATION FOR FUNDS. GRANTS OF NON-CASH ITEMS RECEIVED BY THE FOUNDATION ARE TRANSFERRED TO THE COLLEGE AFTER RECEIPT. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPROVED THROUGH GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE'S (I) FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR NEED BASED APPLICATIONS, (II) SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE, MADE UP OF FACULTY AND STAFF FROM THE COLLEGE, FOR MERIT BASED APPLICATIONS, OR (III) BOTH FOR APPLICATIONS THAT QUALIFY AS BEING FOR BOTH FOR NEED AND MERIT.

THE FOUNDATION REIMBURSED THE SOCIAL CLUB DUES FOR THE FOUNDATION 'S VICE CHAIR AND PRESIDENT FOR THE USE OF A LOCAL GWINNETT COUNTY DINING CLUB FOR THE ENTERTAINING IN THEIR CAPACITITES WITH THE FOUNDATION. JANN JOSEPH, DIRECTOR, VICE CHAIR, EX-OFFICIO, IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,411.66 FOR THE YEAR; NO PERSONAL USE WAS REPORTED JENNIFER HENDRICKSON, PRESIDENT, EX-OFFICIO, IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,411.66 FOR THE YEAR; NO PERSONAL USE WAS REPORTED.
THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS AN ACCOUNTABLE PLAN FOR EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENTS.

UNRELATED ORGANIZATION COMPENSATION: JENNIFER HENDRICKSON, PRESIDENT, EX-OFFICIO, FOR SERVICES RENDERED TO THE FOUNDATION: 15% OF W-2 COMPENSATION, $18,450 15% OF NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS, $5,792 GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE FOUNDATION HAS NO EMPLOYEES; THEREFORE, NO COMPENSATION WAS REPORTED IN PART II. ALL COMPENSATION REPORTED ON THE FORM 990 IN PART VII, SECTION A FOR SERVICES RENDERED TO GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE FOUNDATION IS FROM GEORGIA GWINNETT COLLEGE, AN ORGANIZATION UNRELATED TO THE FOUNDATION UNDER AGREEMENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM OF GEORGIA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS COMPOSED OF BUSINESS, GOVERNMENT, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS IN THE LOCAL AREA. DUE TO THE EXTENSIVE INVOLVEMENT OF THESE COMMUNITY LEADERS IN BUSINESS AND OTHER COMMUNTY AFFAIRS, THE TRUSTEES MAY HAVE NORMAL BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS THAT MIGHT BE EXPECTED OF LEADERS IN A SUBURBAN COMMUNITY. HOWEVER, THESE BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS SHALL BE CONDUCTED AT ARMS' LENGTH, PURSUANT TO NORMAL BUSINESS TERMS AND THE GGCF'S CODE OF CONDUCT/CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. FORM 990, PART IV, LINE 28A-28C: THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES IS COMPOSED OF BUSINESS, GOVERNMENT, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS IN THE LOCAL AREA. THOUGH NO LEASES, CONTRACTS, LOANS, OR OTHER AGREEMENTS EXIST AT PRESENT BETWEEN GGCF AND A MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SUCH AGREEMENTS MAY BE ENTERED INTO AT A LATER DATE. THIS CAN ONLY BE EXPECTED WHERE MANY OF THE LEADERS IN A COMMUNITY SERVE TOGETHER ON A BOARD OF TRUSTEES. HOWEVER, THESE BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS SHALL BE CONDUCTED AT ARMS' LENGTH, PURSUANT TO NORMAL BUSINESS TERMS AND THE GGCF'S CODE OF CONDUCT/CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO BEING FILED. THE REVIEW OF THE 990 IS DOCUMENTED IN THE RESPECTIVE FINANCE COMMITTEE'S MEETING MINUTES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY TO ALL TRUSTEES AND OFFICERS, AND EACH COVERED PERSON MUST SUBMIT A DISCLOSURE OF ANY CONFLICTS THAT EXIST TO THE FOUNDATION. IN ADDITION, ANY SITUATIONS THAT ARISE THOUGHOUT THE YEAR MUST BE BROUGHT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE FOUNDATION IMMEDIATELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE NOT COMPENSATED BY THE FOUNDATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND INTERNAL POLICIES ARE GIVEN TO TRUSTEES WHEN THEY ACCEPT THE DUTY TO SERVE ON THE BOARD OF THE FOUNDATION AND ARE AVAILABLE WITHIN THE FOUNDATION'S OFFICE TO THOSE WHO FALL UNDER THEIR COVENANTS, BUT AS PROPRIETARY INFORMATION OF THE FOUNDATION, THEY AND THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC.
THE PROCESS BY WHICH THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD CHOOSES AN AUDITOR AND REVIEWS THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
